topics.title: JavaScript Modules
topics.description: Learn ES6 modules, import/export, module patterns, and code organization

contents.title: Introduction to Modules
contents.content:
Modules allow you to break code into separate files and import/export functionality between them.

Why Use Modules?
â€¢ Code Organization: Split large files
â€¢ Reusability: Use code across projects
â€¢ Maintainability: Easier to update
â€¢ Namespace: Avoid naming conflicts
â€¢ Dependency Management: Clear dependencies
â€¢ Performance: Load only what's needed

Module Types:

1. ES6 Modules (Modern):
   â€¢ Native JavaScript modules
   â€¢ import/export syntax
   â€¢ Supported in modern browsers
   â€¢ Used in React, Vue, etc.

2. CommonJS (Node.js):
   â€¢ require() and module.exports
   â€¢ Used in Node.js
   â€¢ Synchronous loading

3. AMD (Asynchronous Module Definition):
   â€¢ RequireJS
   â€¢ Browser-focused
   â€¢ Less common now

ES6 Module Features:
â€¢ Static structure (analyzed before execution)
â€¢ Automatic strict mode
â€¢ Top-level this is undefined
â€¢ File-based scope
â€¢ Asynchronous loading
